alert.note: Alert for Cottle; Hall; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 09 at 11:41PM CDT until June 10 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT FOR CHILDRESS...NORTHEASTERN MOTLEY...NORTHERN COTTLE AND SOUTHEASTERN HALL COUNTIES... At 1140 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Dodson to 4 miles northwest of Childress to 9 miles southeast of Turkey, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. At 1135 PM CDT, the West Texas Mesonet near Childress measured a wind gust of 60 mph. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Childress, Northfield, Cee Vee, Tell, Kirkland, and Swearingen. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
